free_text.Content: LECTURES:[br/]How to find, read and comment a scientific paper: what is the message, the motivation, the methods used ?[br/]How to use web of science /scopus etc.[br/][br/] Description of modern experimental techniques:[br/][li] what physical principle is it based on, what kind of information can be gained[br/][li] what type of samples, preparation[br/][li] what are the method's limits, sensitivity, resolution[br/][li] typical time, costs etc.[br/][br/]Structural characterization methods: X-ray, electron diffraction, SEM, TEM[br/]Chemical characterization: EDX, EELS[br/]Tomographic methods (X-ray, Electron microscopy, atom-probe)[br/]Surface analysis: Auger, XPS, RBS, SIMS[br/]Electrical properties: measurement of conductivity and mobility, photocurrent spectroscopythermal[br/]Optical techniques: micro/macro photoluminescence, photolumnescence excitation spectroscopy, Raman spectroscopy[br/]Scanning probe techniques.AFM, STM, MFM, SNOM[br/]Mechanical and thermal properties:    Elastic resonance, speed of sound, Dilatometry, DSC, fracture energy, Laser flash, steady state conductivity [br/][br/]RECITATION/EXERCISES:[br/]Presentation of a scientific paper: summarizing the findings, are the methods used adequate, comment on the results, what is the context, rating (quality, importance). Answering questions.[br/]
